Xero Account Access: We will ensure you have the required access permissions to Melt Media's Xero account.Step 2. Review Previous Records: Briefly review any existing bookkeeping records to understand the company's financial transactions and accounting practices.Transactions RecordingBank Transactions: Reconcile all bank transactions for the period being covered. This includes checking bank feeds, matching transactions, and categorizing them accurately.Invoices and Bills: Ensure all sales invoices and purchase bills are correctly entered into Xero. Verify the details (dates, amounts, and recipients) against actual invoices and receipts.Expense Claims: Record any expense claims, ensuring they are properly documented and approved as per Melt Media's expense policy.Payroll Transactions: Verify payroll entries for accuracy and completeness, if applicable.Account ReconciliationBank Reconciliation: Reconcile all bank accounts, ensuring the transactions in Xero match the bank statements.Credit Card Reconciliation: Reconcile credit card statements, ensuring all transactions are recorded and categorized.Petty Cash: If applicable, reconcile petty cash transactions, ensuring all cash transactions are recorded.Financial ReportingTrial Balance: Run a trial balance to ensure that debits equal credits and there are no unexplained entries.Profit and Loss Statement: Prepare a profit and loss statement for the period to provide an overview of the company's financial performance.Balance Sheet: Generate a balance sheet to show the company's financial position at the end of the period.Cash Flow Statement: Prepare a cash flow statement to analyze the inflows and outflows of cash within the company.Review and ComplianceTax Compliance: Ensure all relevant tax transactions are recorded correctly, including sales tax, VAT, or GST, as applicable.Financial Review Meeting: Schedule a meeting with Melt Media's management or financial team to review the financial reports, discuss any discrepancies, and address queries.Documentation and Receipts: Ensure all financial transactions are supported by the appropriate documentation. Store these documents securely, either in Xero or in a designated cloud storage, for easy access and reference.Data Security: Maintain the confidentiality and security of Melt Media's financial data at all times.Final StepsFeedback and Recommendations: Provide feedback on the bookkeeping process, including any challenges faced and recommendations for improvements in financial recording or processes.Closing Report: Submit a final bookkeeping report summarizing activities undertaken, significant findings, and the status of the accounts.ExpectationsAccuracy: Ensure all financial data entered into Xero is accurate and reflects Melt Media's transactions correctly.Timeliness: Complete the bookkeeping tasks within the agreed-upon timeframe.Communication: Maintain open and clear communication with Melt Media's team, especially regarding any discrepancies, questions, or additional information needed.Confidentiality: Treat all company financial information with strict confidentiality and integrity.This is a list of our expectations if applicable to the account, however many of the things listed aren't required and the book keeping should be rather straight forward as all we need is for things to be properly categorized for our tax accountant to look at later.Posted On: February 15, 2024 20:00 UTCCategory: BookkeepingSkills:Xero, Bookkeeping, Accounting Basics, Accounting Software, Bank Reconciliation, Accounts Payable, Accounting, Balance Sheet, Accounts Receivable, Cash Flow StatementSkills: Xero, Bookkeeping, Accounting Basics, Accounting Software, Bank Reconciliation, Accounts Payable, Accounting, Balance Sheet, Accounts Receivable, Cash Flow StatementCountry: United States""

original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""We require a developer who has experience with, and who is comfortable working within Pipedrive, to create a bespoke and flexible HTML email template.Brief:We require a flexible email template, built through HTML within Pipedrive, to start running our monthly email campaigns.The template has been designed in Figma, which you can access here: [REDACTED_URL] see the design is made up of various sections/blocks (‘Something we’re fans of’, ‘Something to listen to’, etc. etc.). For some months we will have all of these blocks, for others we might only have two blocks. As such we require a template that will allow us to pick and choose which blocks we would like to use for a given month.The title, copy and links of each block will of course change each week, so we need the ability to go in and edit these elements, whilst still keeping the block styling.For each block, we would then need the ability to select different variables. Variable requirements are:No FillFillOutlineFor Fill and Outline, we then need the ability to select colour variables (pink or orange). Mock ups of these have been supplied in the design fill.We also need the ability to add buttons to each block. Similar to the above, we require the buttons to be either Fill or Outline. With the ability to select Pink or Orange.There will also be occasions where we do not use a button, but use a hyperlink instead. Again the hyperlinks must support either Pink or Orange.All variations detailed above, have been mocked up in the design file. If any further clarity is needed, or further design mock-ups are needed, please let me know.We need an easy-to-use template that can facilitate all of the above.Question - You’ll notice that within our block titles, we have used emojis. What is the easiest way to use these within HTML?More detailed requirements are listed below.Please review, and raise any concerns prior to the project starting.- We require the ability to date individual emails- The typeface used throughout is Matter SQ which we can provide- All instances of links/hyperlinks to open in a new tab- The body of the email must be thinner than a typical webpage to support long form text. For the purpose of the design I have worked with a 6 column grid layout (100px with 20px gutted)Colours used:- Orange Hex code #E5698B- Pink Hex code #F75E8A- Black Hex code #[REDACTED_NUM]- Beige (page background) Hex code #F8F8E9Link destinations:Logo - [REDACTED_URL] US ON LINKEDIN hyperlink -[REDACTED_URL] link as standardHourly Range: $15.00-$35.00Posted On: February 13, 2024 13:54 UTCCategory: Front-End DevelopmentSkills:HTML, Email Campaign Setup, Email MarketingSkills: HTML, Email Campaign Setup, Email MarketingCountry: United Kingdom""

original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""I am a solo entrepreneur with experience managing software projects. I want to create a cross-platform iOS and Android alarm app with a special method of disabling the alarm: facial expression recognition. The alarm functions would be very simple, similar to the built-in alarm functions of each mobile OS clock app. But instead of a button to turn off the alarm, the user will be prompted to make a specific facial expression. The alarm will only disable when the front-facing camera detects the specified facial expression, for example a smile, or a frown.This alarm app is similar to a reference application that no longer works on modern devices. You can see a description and example images here: [REDACTED_URL] here:[REDACTED_URL] that this previous app is only used for reference. The concept of using face recognition to disable an alarm is not patented, copyrighted, or trademarked, and no infringement of intellectual property is intended or allowed in the development of this app.I believe that both iOS and Android include local, on-device facial recognition libraries that should be able to perform the required face recognition and identify simple expressions such as "frown", "smile", etc. A full list of expressions for detection will be provided, but it should be no more than 5-6 total.The final additional capability of the app would be to capture an image of the user making the expression that disables the alarm each time it activates. The image would be saved to the user's Images or Downloads folder with a Caption showing the facial expression the user was prompted to make for that alarm activation instance. When the image is captured it is shown to the user and a Share function is available within the app to immediately share the captured image to the OS-provided share destinations, e.g. social media apps, etc.An outline of the desired features is shown in bullet points attached here as an image, along with some example images of the app linked to above for reference.Please note: if development is significantly easier and/or cheaper on one platform or the other, iOS or Android, and much harder or more expensive cross-platform, I will consider focusing only on the easier platform for an initial application. But I would prefer cross-platform. I am an Android user so that would be most easy for me to test, but I have access to Mac devoices for testing in a dev environment (I do not have an iOS device at this time).There are additional features to implement in future versions of the app, so a successful developer will have potential future work as well. Thank you for considering my project and I look forward to the possibility of working with you!Budget: $1,000Posted On: February 23, 2024 03:32 UTCCategory: Mobile App DevelopmentSkills:Face Detection, Android, iOS, Mobile App Development, iOS Development, Android App DevelopmentSkills: Face Detection, Android, iOS, Mobile App Development, iOS Development, Android App DevelopmentCountry: United States""

content: Delivered name, scott, and-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""My name is Scott and I created Millennial Tarot, a semi-ironic deck of tarot cards that I sell online and in book stores. It is a deck of cards that updates traditional tarot with contemporary Millennial humor and wisdom. For example, the original tarot “The Devil” is "The F&ckBoy", “The Hermit” is renamed as “Off-The-Grid”, and “The Chariot” is “Van Life”. We've sold out twice, and now we're creating a much requested Gen Z version. I'm a Millennial, however, and need help coming up with the funny terms and writing the descriptions for a Gen Z themed deck.For those unfamiliar with tarot, people think of it as a fortune-telling tool or cards for psychics, but millions of people use it as a tool to analyze what’s going on in their life and it's become very popular among Millennials and Gen Z. I try to make it way more approachable by making it funny and relatable Millennial humor, and I want to do the same with Gen Z humor but need help.Please feel free to explore the deck and artwork in the current Millennial deck here www.millennialtarot.com/cards.Role & Responsibilities:* You'll receive a spreadsheet detailing the traditional 78 tarot card names and meanings alongside the Millennial name and descriptions for reference.* Your task is to create a list of Gen Z-related slang, expressions, archetypes, and struggles that encapsulate the essence of each card that could be used as the Gen Z name for that card.Benefits:* Hourly pay.* If all goes well, opportunity for contract to write the guidebook, as well.* You'll work independently, on your own time and relatively at your own pace. You are welcome to use me as a resource to ask questions, but do not need to.* I think it's a fun activity and really enjoyed doing it for Millennial Tarot!Requirements:* Deep familiarity with Gen Z culture, including but not limited to memes, slang, expressions, archetypes, humor, and struggles.* Interest and knowledge in spirituality and tarot is a plus but not required.* Many, but not all, of the cards are funny, so a sense of humor is also a huge plus.Let me know if this is something that would interest you and you feel like you could do a good job at. If so, I may ask for a writing sample, or give you 3 or 4 cards to come up with equivalent Gen Z names for as a trial for the whole 78. Thank you for reading this message and I hope to hear from you!Best regards,ScottHourly Range: $5.00-$35.00Posted On: February 19, 2024 18:00 UTCCategory: Creative WritingSkills:Creative Writing, Humor, Content Writing, Humor WritingSkills: Creative Writing, Humor, Content Writing, Humor WritingLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""

content: Delivered have, keen, interest-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""I have a keen interest in interior design but never had the time to study it because of my work. However, with the little knowledge I have, I have been trying to design my rental apartments myself with the concept of wabi-sabi.The design is very minimal and aesthetic but all the necessary elements are still available. 60% of the design is complete need help with 40%.I have been using arches as my primary shape, and the furniture designs are low in height to give a feeling of high ceilings. The lighting consists of bamboo pendant lights and straw lights, but I feel the design still lacks something and doesn't feel complete. I am stuck with designing two bedrooms one with a queen-size bed and the other with a twin bed aswell. I have created some designs, but I am not completely satisfied with them as I feel it’s not cohesive and complete, and I'm having a hard time. I have three colors in mind: white, pine wood color, and brass color, with white being the main color (60%), pine wood being the secondary color (30%), and brass being the highlight color (10%).I am looking for someone who can improve the existing design so that all the interiors align with the arch shape and wabi sabi concept. I need sizes for the furniture, complete design for one queen bedroom and one twin bedroom, entrance reception, lighting , rendering and improvements for other rooms with necessary requirements. I have already purchased most of the items, and I can send pictures as well.Requirement and expectation:1. Alignment with Concept: Ensure that all interior designs align with the concept of wabi-sabi, focusing on simplicity, natural elements, and imperfection with the current design.2. Improvement of Existing Design: Enhance the current design to make it feel complete and cohesive. Address any perceived shortcomings and ensure that the design reflects the concept and vision accurately.3. Furniture Sizing: Provide specifications for the sizes of furniture pieces to ensure they fit well within the space and contribute to the desired aesthetic.4. Complete Bedroom Designs: Develop detailed designs for both the queen-size bedroom and the twin bedroom, considering factors such as layout, furniture placement, color scheme, and lighting.5. Color Scheme: Incorporate the specified color scheme of white (60%), pine wood (30%), and brass (10%) throughout the design, with white as the dominant color and brass used as accents.6. Utilization of Purchased Items: Work with the items you've already purchased to integrate them seamlessly into the design, ensuring they complement the overall aesthetic.7. Necessary Improvements: Identify and implement any necessary improvements or additions to other rooms, taking into account functional requirements and aesthetic preferences.8. Collaboration and Communication: Maintain open communication throughout the design process, considering your input and feedback to ensure the final result meets your expectations.9. Budget Considerations: Keep in mind that the apartment is leased, and therefore, expenses for permanent alterations should be minimized. Prioritize design elements and modifications that can be easily removed or reversed without significant cost or damage to the property. Focus on cost-effective solutions and utilize existing resources wherever possible to stay within budget constraints.Budget: $200Posted On: February 16, 2024 13:16 UTCCategory: Interior DesignSkills:Hotel Design, Interior Design, SketchUp, Residential Design, 3D Rendering, Commercial DesignSkills: Hotel Design, Interior Design, SketchUp, Residential Design, 3D Rendering, Commercial DesignCountry: United States""

content: Delivered kindergarten, decodable, book-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""Kindergarten Decodable Book GhostwritersWe are seeking talented experienced writers to join our team in a contract position. In this role you will have the opportunity to create culturally responsive decodable texts that help early readers build their foundational reading skills. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in phonics and deep understanding of the Science of Reading. We are eager to build our team. Success on this project could lead to future projects with our team.The goal of the books is to provide children with unit-aligned, connected, decodable text in an engaging, illustrated or photo based, book format. These books will be used across the globe, so cultural representation and inclusion is required.The text must use highly decodable words from the prescribed Scope and Sequence in a natural-sounding, engaging way.Each book will have:- 80% decodable, grade-appropriate text- target HFW and sufficient skill words- high-quality/high-interest topics aligned to the unit knowledge strands,- unique and creative, visually captivating approaches and presentations.Responsibilities:- Create anywhere from 2 - 8 age-appropriate Fiction and/or Nonfiction decodable texts that align with a specific phonics focused Scope and Sequence.- Each books will be 8 pages in length with 20 - 30 phonics-skill-specific words- Authors will also write detailed art specs for each page- Adapt writing style to incorporate specific phonics skills and sight words- Create engaging and culturally diverse stories that reflect a variety of backgrounds and experiences.- Authors will work with a cultural consultant to create art specs that align with certain cultures- Track and record phonics skill words used in each book- Collaborate with the editorial team to revise and edit concepts and manuscripts based on feedback.- Adhere to deadlinesQualifications:- Experience working with or writing decodable texts, phonics practice materials, and/or early reading materials.- Sound understanding of how to follow a Scope and Sequence to create decodable texts.- Strong understanding of phonics and early literacy development.- A strong passion for early childhood education and commitment to including diversity in children’s literature.- Experience working with lower elementary students is a plus.Compensation will be $325 per deliverable broken into milestones:- Milestone #1: $175 for concept once approved- Milestone #2: $150 for manuscript once approvedPlease provide any information that highlights your experience with decodable texts as well as a writing sample or portfolio showcasing your work for young readers if you are able.Budget: $325Posted On: February 15, 2024 20:53 UTCCategory: Creative WritingSkills:Nonfiction, Fiction, Creative Writing, GhostwritingSkills: Nonfiction, Fiction, Creative Writing, GhostwritingLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""
